lines.text: [first lines]
September 21, 1945... that was the night I died.
Seita. Have one.
[Holds out rocks]
Setsuko, what?
Rice balls. I made them for you. Here, have one.
[Seita starts crying]
You don't want them?
Setsuko.
[Cries]
Why must fireflies die so young?

[about Setsuko]
She never woke up again.
She's been having diarrhea for a while now, and prickly heat and rashes all over. And salt water seems to be hurting her skin.

[writing]
Weakening from malnutrition. Due to the diarrhea. Next patient.
Can you give her medicine or a shot? Please, doctor, help her.
Give her medicine? All this child needs is some food.
She needs food... WHERE AM I SUPPOSED TO GET FOOD?
Seita, should I get a doctor? Why did he hurt you?
[Setsuko's final words]
Seita. Thank you.
[last lines]

[to Setsuko]
Time for bed.
Seita, is our house gone too?
Probably...
I hate the shelter.
Well you'll be sorry if you get blown up by a bomb.
I lost a shoe!
Don't worry, I'll buy you the better ones!
Everything is gone.
Wow, Setsuko, you're rich.
It's a huge bathtub!
Look! It's rice, Setsuko!
Rain, rain, fall, fall. So happy my big brother came with an umbrella to take me home.
Rain, rain, fall, fall. So happy my big brother came with an umbrella to take me home.
I can taste so many flavors!
We don't have a home. It was burned.
This will be the kitchen!
Heard you can eat those, too.
Look it's a hairpin.
Now, let's see a firefly show!
Why do fireflies have to die so soon?
I'm sorry! Please let go of me! Only wanted some sugar for my sick sister
Nutrition? But where do I get that?
Seita. Water.
I don't need anything. Please stay home with me. Don't go! Don't go! Don't go!
Then, I'll never ever leave. I'll always be with you.
Seita. This is for you. It's steamed rice. Here's some cooked soy pulp. Please eat. You're not having any?
See? It's watermelon. I didn't have to steal this either.
Seita. Thank you.
